SEARCH

All Classes and Interfaces

Class
Description
AddCardCommand
AddCardCommand class represents a command to add a card to a player's hand.
AddStarterCommand
AddStarterCommand class represents a command to add a starter card to a player's manuscript Implements Command interface.
BackFace
The BackFace class represents the back face of a card
Board
Represents the scoreboard that tracks players' scores
Card
The Card class represents a basic card in the game It implements the Serializable interface to allow for object serialization
Chat
The Chat class represents a chat between players in the game.
ChatMessage
ChatMessage class represents a message in a chat.
ChooseGameSceneController
second scene of initialization, player can create a new game or join an existing one
ChooseObjectiveCommand
ChooseObjectiveCommand class represents a command to choose an objective card for a player Implements the Command interface.
ChooseObjectiveSceneController
third scene of initialization, players can choose their secret objective card from the two objective cards displayed
ChooseObjectiveState
Represents the state where a player chooses their personal secret objective card This state allows the player to select an objective card that will contribute to their final score
ClientBoard
The ClientBoard interface provides methods for accessing player points, scoreboards, and player colors in the Board Board
ClientChat
The ClientChat interface provides methods for accessing chat participants, chat messages, and checking if a user is part of the chat.
ClientHandler
The ClientHandler class handles client connections as server for the client and as the VirtualView for the model.
ClientManuscript
The ClientManuscript interface provides methods for accessing and manipulating manuscript data, including counters of any Corner Symbol, placements, the manuscript field and the vertical and horizontal maximum extension of the manuscript
ClientMarket
The ClientMarket interface provides methods for accessing the market data, therefore face-up cards, resource deck, gold deck, and common objectives.
ClientPlayer
The ClientPlayer interface provides methods for accessing player-related data, including player state, pawn colour, manuscript, objectives, username, hand, and starter card.
ColourControl
 
Command
Command interface represents all the command to be executed in the game, according to the command pattern.
ContinueGameMessage
The ContinueGameMessage class represents a message indicating that the game may continue after the disconnection a player, resuming the game flow It extends the Message class and implements the reportUpdate method.
Corner
The Corner class represents a corner of a card in the game This class is used in every card, except for objective cards where every corner is BLACK and the symbol is EMPTY
CornerSymbol
The CornerSymbol enum represents the different symbols that can appear in the cards' corners.
DifferentPattern
The DifferentPattern class represents a specific type of objective card This class is used to check for and score a "DifferentPattern" objective in the game
DoublePattern
The DoublePattern class represents a specific type of objective card This class is used to check for and score a "DoublePattern" objective in the game
DrawCardCommand
DrawCardCommand class represents a command to draw a card for a player.
DrawingState
Represents the state where a player draws a card from the market This state allows the player to draw either a gold card or a resource card from the market
EndingSceneController
Controller for the ending scene displaying game results.
EndingState
Represents the ending state of a player in the game This state is reached when the player has finished their last turn When every player has reached this state, the Objective Cards points calculation will start
EndOfTurnState
Represents the end of a turn state of a player in the game
Face
The Face class represents a face of a card in the game (front or back) It implements the Serializable interface to allow for object serialization
FrontFace
The FrontFace class represents the front face of a card
Game
Represents the game where players participate and play against each other
GameController
The GameController class is responsible for managing the overall state, flow of the game and all the components that interact in the game It handles player actions, game state transitions, command execution, and game suspension This class works closely with the Game, Player, and TurnHandler classes to coordinate gameplay.
GenericController
An abstract class representing a generic controller.
GenericErrorMessage
The GenericErrorMessage class represents an error message in the game It extends the Message class and implements the reportUpdate method In this case the Minimodel's instance only has the currentPlayer and the string set The currentPlayer is the player that has to receive the message
GigaController
The GigaController class manages multiple game controllers and handles player connections, disconnections, and game creation
GoldCard
The GoldCard class represents a card that gives points based on certain requirements only if all the criteria are met you can play this card
Gui
The Gui class is responsible for managing the graphical user interface of the game It implements the View interface and follows the singleton pattern to ensure only one instance is used This class handles scene switching, user interactions, and updates from the game server, displaying every update in the current scene
HandCardData
This class represents the data for a hand card, including its index in the hand and whether it is facing front or back.
Initializer
The Initializer class sets up and initializes components required to start a game.
InitializingState
Represents the initializing state of a player in the game State in which a player adds the starter card to their manuscript
IpChecker
The IpChecker class provides utility methods for checking IP addresses.
JoinGameSceneController
Controller for the Join Game scene where players can enter a game ID to join an existing game.
JsonParser
The JsonParser class is used to retrieve all the information to correctly build card objects, parsing a .json file at runtime.
Kingdom
The Kingdom enum represents the different kingdoms that can exist in the game.
KoMessage
The KoMessage class represents a negative acknowledgment message in the game It extends the Message class and implements the reportUpdate method
LadderPattern
The LadderPattern class represents a specific type of objective card This class is used to check for and score a "Ladder Pattern" objective in the game
LastRoundMessage
The LastRoundMessage class represents a message indicating the last round of the game It extends the Message class and implements the reportUpdate method
LoginSceneController
Controller for the Login scene where players can enter their username and choose a pawn colour.
MainApp
The MainApp class is the entry point for the JavaFX application.
MainClient
The MainClient class represents the main client application.
Manuscript
This class represents the manuscript or playing field of a player in the game.
ManuscriptCardData
This class represents the data used in accessing or modifying manuscript data in particular x and y coordinates.
ManuscriptSceneController
Controller for the Manuscript scene where players can place cards on their manuscripts, draw cards from the market and chat.
Market
This class represents the market in the game, where players can draw cards either from decks or exposed cards
MarketCardData
This class represents the data used in accessing or modifying market card data in particular whether it is gold, from the deck and the face up card index.
Message
The abstract class Message serves as the base class for all message types in the game.
MiniModel
MiniModel class represents a simplified model of the game state.
NewGameSceneController
Controller for the New Game scene where players can choose the number of players for the new game.
ObjectiveCard
objective cards are non-playable cards essential for the game, they give points to the player at the end of the match if all the criteria are met
OkMessage
The OkMessage class represents a message indicating a successful operation It extends the Message class and implements the reportUpdate method
PawnColour
The PawnColour enum represents the different colors that a pawn can have in the game.
PingCommand
PingCommand class represents a command to ping the server Implements the Command interface.
PingMessage
The PingMessage class represents a message used for ping operations It extends the Message class but does not perform any specific action in the PingMessage.reportUpdate(VirtualView, View) method
Placement
The Placement class represents a placement with x and y coordinates This class is used to encapsulate the coordinates of a placement and provide getters to access these coordinates The Placement class implements the Serializable to allow instances of this class to be serialized
PlaceStarterCardSceneController
Controller class for the PlaceStarterCard scene in the GUI.
Player
This class represents a player in the game
PlayerJoinedMessage
The PlayerJoinedMessage class represents a message indicating that a player has joined the game It extends the Message class and is intended to be received by all players
PlayerListener
The PlayerListener class listens for updates to be sent to a specific player.
PlayerState
The PlayerState class represents the state of a player in the game's state pattern It manages actions that a player can perform based on their current state
PlayingState
Represents the playing state of a player in the game This state allows the player to add cards to their personal manuscript
Point
The class represents a point in a 2D space with coordinates (x, y) and an associated count.
PointsMultiplier
The PointsMultiplier enum represents the different multipliers that can be applied to card points in the game.
ReconnectedPlayerMessage
The ReconnectedPlayerMessage class represents a message indicating that a player has reconnected to the game.
ReconnectPlayerCommand
ReconnectPlayerCommand class represents a command to reconnect a disconnected player.
ResourceCard
The ResourceCard class represents a card that provides resources and occasionally points in the game
RmiClient
The RmiClient class implements the VirtualView interface and represents the client in the RMI network.
RmiServer
The RmiServer class implements the VirtualServer interface and represents the server in the RMI network.
ScenePaths
This enum contains the paths to the FXML files of the various scenes.
SendMessageCommand
SendMessageCommand class represents a command to send a chat message from one player to another.
ServerApp
 
SetUsernameMessage
The SetUsernameMessage class represents a message used to set a player's username.
SocketClient
The RmiClient class implements the VirtualView interface and represents the client in the RMI network.
SocketServer
The SocketServer class manage the connection with the client when they want to create a connection Then create a personal ClientHandler for each client.
SocketServerProxy
Proxy server that manages the connection between the client and the remote server using sockets.
StarterCard
The StarterCard class represents the first card played that initializes the whole playing field
StarterSceneController
first scene of the game as the GUI is launched displays logo and "Play" button
StringMessage
The StringMessage class represents a generic string message, mainly used for socket communication.
SuspendedGameMessage
The SuspendedGameMessage class represents a message indicating that the game has been suspended It extends the Message class and a string message
SuspendPlayerCommand
SuspendPlayerCommand class represents a command to suspend a player from the game.
ThreeKingdomPattern
The ThreeKingdomPattern class represents a specific type of objective card This class is used to check for and score a "ThreeKingdomPattern" objective in the game
Tui
The Tui class represents the Text User Interface of the game.
TurnHandler
The TurnHandler class manages the flow and continuity of turns in the game.
TwoPlusOnePattern
The TwoPlusOnePattern class represents a specific type of objective card This class is used to check for and score a "TwoPlusOnePattern" objective in the game
UpdateChatMessage
The UpdateChatMessage class represents a message updating the chat state It extends the Message class
UpdateEndGameMessage
The UpdateEndGameMessage class represents a message updating the end game state It extends the Message class and wraps the board in the MiniModel
UpdateHandMessage
The UpdateHandMessage class represents a message updating the hand of a specific player It extends the Message class and encapsulates the MiniModel containing the player's hand information
UpdateMarketMessage
The UpdateMarketMessage class represents a message updating the market for all players It extends the Message class and wraps the updated market information in the Minimodel
UpdateMyManuscriptMessage
The UpdateMyManuscriptMessage class represents a message updating the player's manuscript It extends the Message class and encapsulates the MiniModel containing the updated player's manuscript information, the player whose manuscript is being updated and the string set This message is intended to be received only by the player whose manuscript has been updated
UpdateObjectiveMessage
The UpdateObjectiveMessage class represents a message updating the player's secret objective choice.
UpdateOtherManuscriptMessage
The UpdateOtherManuscriptMessage class represents a message updating the manuscript of another player It extends the Message class and encapsulates the MiniModel containing the updated manuscripts mapping and board This message is intended to update the manuscripts of another player and the game board.
UpdatePlayerStateMessage
The UpdatePlayerStateMessage class represents a message updating the state of a player It extends the Message class and encapsulates the MiniModel containing the updated player state.
UpdateStartOfGameMessage
The UpdateStartOfGameMessage class represents a message indicating the start of the game It extends the Message class and encapsulates the MiniModel containing the initial state of the game and a string message warning other player's of the start This message is intended to update the client's MiniModel with the initial game state at the start of the game.
View
The View interface represents the collection of methods for displaying and interacting with game-related information.
VirtualServer
The VirtualServer interface represents a server in the application.
VirtualView
The VirtualView interface represents a client's view in the application.
WaitingState
Represents the waiting state of a player in the game State in which players wait for other players to add a starter card, choose an objective or play their turn
YourTurnMessage
The YourTurnMessage class represents a message indicating that it is the player's turn to play It extends the Message class and encapsulates the MiniModel containing the player's state and a string message notifying a player that it is their turn to take action in the game
